But I just realized that now myself

summary: I am rewatching campaign one and I just realized that Scanlan and Percy probably should have permanently died while fighting...
body: I am rewatching campaign one and I just realized that Scanlan and Percy probably should have permanently died while fighting that white dragon in episode 19. They were still learning all the rules from the change over Pathfinder so it is understandable.

blog.name: brightandshinynewstories
blog.title: What's This Blog About? I Don't Know Either
blog.description:
I like so many things. Maybe too many.
27, she/her, icon by @sheepskin

summary: Matt: *has everyone but Ashley leave the room so that he can give a grand, sweeping monologue involving dark, terrifying imagery...
body:
Matt: *has everyone but Ashley leave the room so that he can give a grand, sweeping monologue involving dark, terrifying imagery involving the big storm that just came down on the m9′s camp, but that ends with Yasha face to face with her god(?), being reassured that she’s on the right path, followed by her waking up to the storm receding*

Ashley, clearly stunned by this intense and beautiful imagery: okay, okay okay okay

Me, listening to this and the rain currently hitting my windows, looking up at the end to see the actual storm outside stopping and giving way to sunlight: okay okay okay okay

reblog.comment:
Matt: *has everyone but Ashley leave the room so that he can give a grand, sweeping monologue involving dark, terrifying imagery involving the big storm that just came down on the m9′s camp, but that ends with Yasha face to face with her god(?), being reassured that she’s on the right path, followed by her waking up to the storm receding*

Ashley, clearly stunned by this intense and beautiful imagery: okay, okay okay okay

Me, listening to this and the rain currently hitting my windows, looking up at the end to see the actual storm outside stopping and giving way to sunlight: okay okay okay okay

Ashley, clearly stunned by this intense and beautiful imagery: okay, okay okay okay

blog.name: solanumdulca-mara
blog.title: Tiefling Troubles
blog.description: DnD stories, tips, and modules.

body:
Ya know

One of my favorite things about TAZ is their method of using Zone of Truth. In CR you have the option to just not talk, but in TAZ, EVERYTHING comes out and I love it. You hear NPCs in the back like “i thought Scandal was just alright last night” and “i actually liked the ending of Lost” and It is absolutely useless information but it’s The Truth

reblog.comment:

summary: God I can’t believe I ever thought critical role wouldn’t be as funny as the adventure zone. For context, they were all...
body:
God I can’t believe I ever thought critical role wouldn’t be as funny as the adventure zone.

For context, they were all discussing Fjord’s weird seawater-vomit-inducing dreams, and it devolved into a discussion about drinking saline solution (the stuff you use to clean contact lenses).

reblog.comment:

summary: Is This A New Beginning Or The Start Of Another End - Chapter 1 - MeredithBrody - Critical Role (Web Series) [Archive of Our...
title: Is This A New Beginning Or The Start Of Another End - Chapter 1 - MeredithBrody - Critical Role (Web Series) [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: “Bren?” Caleb didn’t recognise the voice but there was no mistaking that the voice was addressing him. He felt every single one of his friends freeze as they heard that name whispered too. There was no doubt in Caleb’s mind this was someone who knew him in his old life. The life he tried to run from, the life he tried to forget.
description:
I started a new multichapter! It is a crossover, sort of, with the 2000 Dungeons and Dragons movie purely so I could magic Zoe McLellan into my new fandom. I regret nothing about this. So anyway. Please enjoy. It’s a whole lot of Caleb angst, probably.

(spoilers through episode 56, but it’s in a canon-divergent future after that so…)
